title: Pentecostal Schools
description:
Pentecostal schools are Christian educational institutions affiliated with Pentecostal churches and denominations. These schools emphasize biblical teaching alongside belief in the active work of the Holy Spirit.

Key characteristics of Pentecostal schools:

• Strong emphasis on biblical authority and personal faith
• Belief in spiritual gifts including speaking in tongues, healing, and prophecy
• Dynamic worship experiences and prayer
• Focus on evangelism and personal relationship with God
• Character development rooted in Christian values
• Often connected to local Pentecostal churches

Pentecostal schools may be affiliated with various denominations including the Assemblies of God, Church of God, United Pentecostal Church, or independent Pentecostal congregations.

These schools typically emphasize experiential faith alongside academic excellence, with chapel services that may include contemporary worship, prayer, and opportunities for spiritual expression.

When considering a Pentecostal school, ask about their specific denominational affiliation, chapel and worship expectations, and how they approach teaching about spiritual gifts.
